definitions.definition: To seduce, persuade or fascinate someone or something.
definitions.example: He charmed her with his dashing tales of his days as a sailor.

definitions.definition: To use a magical charm upon; to subdue, control, or summon by incantation or supernatural influence.
definitions.example: After winning three games while wearing the chain, Dan began to think it had been charmed.

definitions.definition: To protect with, or make invulnerable by, spells, charms, or supernatural influences.
To subdue or overcome by some secret power, or by that which gives pleasure; to allay; to soothe.
Under a magic spell (cast by a charm); bewitched.
Impressed by the pleasantness of something.
definitions.example: You are very gracious; I am charmed by your personality.

definitions.definition: Of a particle: having nonzero charm.
